quotes.quote: swans ... always look as though they'd just been reading their own fan-mail.
When turkeys mate they think of swans.
Swans live wherever there is water, and leave the place where water dries up; let not a man act so - and comes and goes as he pleases.
Swans sing before they die - 'twere no bad thing should certain persons die before they sing.
Swan flocks of lilies shoreward lying, In sweetness, not in music, dying.
The swan murmurs sweet strains with a flattering tongue, itself the singer of its own dirge.
Even if you enter the dirty water, stay neat like a white swan!

Those who awaken never rest in one place. Like swans, they rise and leave the lake. On the air they rise and fly an invisible course. Their food is knowledge. They live on emptiness. They have seen how to break free. Who can follow them?
The swan, like the soul of the poet, By the dull world is ill understood.
It is best to live with honor for just a day than with dishonor for many decades; better a short lived celestial swan than a century-lived crow.
If you're looking for monogamy, you'd better marry a swan.
The swan who goes on living in its parents' tree will die; this is why those who are beautiful and talented bear the burden of finding their own way in the world.
Being born in a duck yard does not matter, if only you are hatched from a swan's egg.

His own image; no longer a dark, gray bird, ugly and disagreeable to look at, but a graceful and beautiful swan. To be born in a duck's nest, in a farmyard, is of no consequence to a bird, if it is hatched from a swan's egg.
And swans seem whiter if swart crowes be by.
Swans are majestic, beautiful looking creatures. With really ugly temperaments.
No amount of observations of white swans can allow the inference that all swans are white, but the observation of a single black swan is sufficient to refute that conclusion.
But calm, white calm, was born into a swan.
